name: Coach et Générateur de Discours AI utilisant Telegram, Open AI et Gemini
description:
### Description
Ce workflow n8n agit comme votre coach personnel de rédaction de discours AI, directement accessible via Telegram. Il écoute vos brouillons parlés ou tapés, fournit des retours perspicaces sur la clarté, l'engagement, la structure et le contenu, et affine itérativement votre message en fonction de vos mises à jour. Une fois que vous êtes prêt, il synthétise un tout nouveau discours ou une présentation incorporant toutes les améliorations et vos idées accumulées. Cet outil rationalise le processus de rédaction de discours, offrant une assistance AI à la demande pour vous aider à créer des présentations percutantes et bien structurées.

### Comment ça fonctionne
Entrée via Telegram : Vous interagissez avec le workflow en envoyant vos brouillons de discours ou points de discussion directement à un bot Telegram désigné.
Retour AI : Le workflow traite votre entrée en utilisant des modèles AI (OpenAI et/ou Google Gemini) pour analyser divers aspects de votre discours et fournit des retours constructifs via Telegram.
Affinement itératif : Vous pouvez ensuite envoyer des versions mises à jour de votre discours au bot, recevant des retours supplémentaires pour guider vos révisions.
Synthèse de discours : Lorsque vous envoyez la commande "générer un discours", le workflow compile toutes vos entrées précédentes et les retours de l'AI pour synthétiser un nouveau discours ou une présentation améliorée, qui vous est ensuite renvoyée via Telegram.
Nouveau Cycle de Discours : En envoyant la commande "nouveau discours", le workflow efface sa mémoire, vous permettant de recommencer le processus pour un sujet différent.
### Étapes de Configuration (Prend Environ 5 Minutes)
**Étape 1 : Créer un Bot Telegram et Obtenir son ID**
Ouvrez l'application Telegram et recherchez "BotFather". Démarrez une conversation avec BotFather en cliquant sur "Démarrer" ou en envoyant la commande /start. Créez un nouveau bot en envoyant la commande /newbot. Suivez les instructions de BotFather pour choisir un nom et un nom d'utilisateur pour votre bot. Une fois votre bot créé, BotFather vous fournira un jeton API. Gardez ce jeton en sécurité car il est nécessaire pour connecter votre workflow n8n à votre bot.

**Étape 2 : Obtenir une Clé API OpenAI**
Allez sur le site Web d'OpenAI (https://platform.openai.com/) et inscrivez-vous pour un compte si vous n'en avez pas déjà un.
Naviguez vers la section des clés API (généralement sous les paramètres de votre profil ou un onglet "Développeurs"). Cliquez sur "Créer une nouvelle clé secrète". Copiez la clé API générée et conservez-la en sécurité. Vous devrez fournir cette clé à votre workflow n8n pour accéder aux modèles de langage d'OpenAI.

**Étape 3 : Obtenir une Clé API LLM Google Gemini** 
Allez sur la plateforme Google Cloud AI ou le site Google AI Studio (la plateforme spécifique peut varier en fonction des offres AI actuelles de Google ; recherchez "API Google AI"). Inscrivez-vous ou connectez-vous avec votre compte Google. Suivez les instructions pour activer l'API Gemini et créer une clé API. Cela peut impliquer de créer un projet si vous ne l'avez pas déjà fait. Copiez la clé API générée et conservez-la en sécurité. Vous pouvez ensuite configurer votre workflow n8n pour utiliser également les modèles de langage de Google Gemini.

### Options de Personnalisation
Ce workflow n8n offre une flexibilité significative, voici quelques options :
1. Modifier les invites AI pour adapter les retours et la génération pour des présentations, des récits, des entretiens, des discours de vente, des conférences académiques et de l'écriture créative.
2. Passer de l'interface de Telegram à Slack, WhatsApp, ou même une interface web en remplaçant les nœuds n8n pertinents.
3. Intégrer l'analyse pour le sentiment, la densité des mots-clés, le rythme (avec entrée vocale), et la détection des mots de remplissage en ajustant le workflow.
4. Se connecter à des sources de données externes pour fournir un contexte à l'AI pour des retours et une génération plus ciblés.

Cette adaptabilité vous permet de réutiliser ce workflow pour une large gamme de cas d'utilisation spécifiques et d'environnements de communication.

options.systemMessage:
={{ $json.system_prompt }}

You are generating text for a Telegram message. The text should be plain. No * or **

nodes.name: Check For Text or Voice Message
Code to remove unwanted characters from LLM response

parameters.pythonCode:
import re

def clean_markdown_for_telegram(text):
  """
  Removes common Markdown formatting characters from a string.

  Args:
    text: The input string.

  Returns:
    A new string with Markdown characters removed.
  """
  markdown_chars = r"[*_~`\[\]()#+\-=|{}.!]"
  cleaned_text = re.sub(markdown_chars, "", text)
  cleaned_text = " ".join(cleaned_text.split()).strip()
  return cleaned_text

# Loop over input items and create new items with the cleaned text
output_items = []
for item in _input.all():
  feedback_text = item.json.get("output", "")
  cleaned_feedback = clean_markdown_for_telegram(feedback_text)
  output_items.append({"json": {"cleanedText": cleaned_feedback}})

return output_items

nodes.name: Code to split output into chunks under 4000 characters

parameters.pythonCode:
def split_text_for_telegram(text, max_length=4000):
  """
  Splits a long text into a list of strings, each with a maximum length
  suitable for Telegram messages.

  Args:
    text: The input string to split.
    max_length: The maximum length of each resulting string (default: 4000).

  Returns:
    A list of strings, where each string is a chunk of the original text
    with a maximum length of max_length.
  """
  if len(text) <= max_length:
    return [text]

  chunks = []
  start_index = 0
  while start_index < len(text):
    end_index = min(start_index + max_length, len(text))

    split_point = end_index
    if end_index < len(text):
      last_sentence_end = -1
      for i in range(start_index + max_length - 1, start_index - 1, -1):
        if i < len(text) and text[i] in ['.', '?', '!']:
          last_sentence_end = i + 1
          break
      if last_sentence_end > start_index:
        split_point = last_sentence_end

    chunks.append(text[start_index:split_point])
    start_index = split_point

  return chunks

output_items = []
max_length = 4000

for item in _input.all():
  text = item.json.get("cleanedText", "")
  text_chunks = split_text_for_telegram(text, max_length)
  for chunk in text_chunks:
    output_items.append({"json": {"telegramTextChunk": chunk}})

return output_items

nodes.name: Set prompt to start a new speech

assignments.name: system_prompt
assignments.value:
"I am preparing to give a speech. Your role is to act as my speech preparation assistant. Please guide me through the process of getting ready to deliver this speech effectively. Ask me relevant questions and suggest steps we should take to ensure a successful presentation.

Potential areas we can work on include:

Defining the core message and key takeaways.
Understanding the audience's needs and expectations.
Structuring the speech for maximum impact.
Crafting engaging content and supporting materials.
Developing effective opening and closing remarks.
Practicing delivery and managing speaking anxiety.
Anticipating potential questions from the audience.
Considering the logistics of the presentation (e.g., time limits, equipment).
Where should we begin?

nodes.name: Set prompt to generate a speech based on the feedback

assignments.name: system_prompt
assignments.value:
I want you to act as a speech synthesizer and improvement agent. You have access to the content of several speeches I have previously provided, along with the constructive feedback I received on each and with this information your task is to generate a new speech.

This new speech should incorporate the following:

Key themes and ideas that were present and well-received in my previous speeches.
Structural elements and transitions that were identified as effective in past feedback.
Engagement techniques that were noted as successful.
Avoidance of areas for improvement highlighted in the feedback (e.g., rambling sections, unclear points, pacing issues).
Incorporation of specific suggestions for improvement that were given.
A similar tone and style to my previous speeches, while aiming for enhanced clarity and impact based on the feedback.
Please provide the complete text of the new speech. Feel free to ask clarifying questions if needed about the new topic, audience, or goal, or if you need a reminder of specific feedback points from my previous speeches. I am ready when you are."

nodes.name: Set prompt to provide feedback on speech

assignments.name: system_prompt
assignments.value: I'd like you to act as a speech feedback agent. I will deliver a speech to you, and I want you to provide constructive criticism and insights on various aspects of my delivery and content.  Please pay attention to:  Clarity and Conciseness: Was the message easy to understand? Were there any parts that felt rambling or unnecessary? Engagement: How engaging was the speech overall? Were there moments where your attention might have drifted? Structure and Flow: Did the speech progress logically? Were the transitions smooth? Pacing and Timing: Was the speech delivered at an appropriate pace? Did it feel rushed or too slow? Vocal Delivery (if applicable): (If you are able to describe vocal elements) How was the tone, pitch, and volume? Did it enhance or detract from the message? Content and Impact: Was the content compelling and relevant? Did the speech achieve its intended purpose (as I will describe beforehand)? What was the overall impact of the message? Strengths: What were the most effective aspects of the speech? Areas for Improvement: What specific suggestions do you have to make the speech even better? Before I begin, I will briefly tell you the topic, my intended audience, and my goal for the speech. Are you ready?

nodes.name: Route Flow Based on Message Content

parameters.content:
## Dynamic System Prompting:

This node sets the AI's system prompt according to the user's request identified in the incoming message.

## Telegram-Ready Output: Formatting and Length Management:

These code nodes perform two crucial tasks:
1.  **Formatting:** Removing characters that could cause issues with Telegram's message parsing.
2.  **Chunking:** Dividing messages longer than Telegram's 4000-character limit into multiple shorter messages for sequential delivery.

## Clearing AI Agent Memory:

This node clears the AI agent's short-term memory. This helps to minimize the influence of past interactions on future responses, thereby reducing the likelihood of the AI generating inaccurate or irrelevant information (hallucinations).

## Processing Telegram Messages:

This section handles incoming messages from Telegram. It first checks if the message contains text.

1.  **Text Message:** If the message includes text, it's directly routed to the analysis switch node.
2.  **Audio Message:** If the message is an audio file:
    * The audio file is downloaded.
    * The audio is transcribed into text.
    * The transcribed text is then sent to the analysis switch node.

Finally, the analyzed text (whether directly from a text message or transcribed from audio) is forwarded for further processing based on the analysis results.

## Gemini-Powered Response and Conversation Storage:

This node utilizes the Google Gemini model to generate a response to the user's prompt and stores the ongoing conversation.

## This n8n workflow acts as your personal AI speechwriting coach, directly accessible through Telegram. It listens to your spoken or typed drafts, provides insightful feedback on clarity, engagement, structure, and content, and iteratively refines your message based on your updates. Once you're ready, it synthesizes a brand-new speech or talk incorporating all the improvements and your accumulated ideas. This tool streamlines the speechwriting process, offering on-demand AI assistance to help you craft impactful and well-structured presentations.

user.bio: Automation Developer with 3+ years building innovative solutions on UiPath, Power Platform, and n8n, also with a strong background in both API development and integration. Now specializing in the creation and implementation of AI Agents.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
